website_summaries.verdict: The Zotac GTX 1050 Mini offers up very serviceable 1080p gaming in a package that's impressively compact. It's no faster than other GTX 1050 cards, but it doesn't cost more, either.
pros: No PCI Express power connector required
cons: Can't always maintain 60fps at 1080p and high settings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this card for my son's computer as he couldn't play the Steam games on the PC with high graphics, e.g. Borderlands, GTA, human fall flat, Castlestory etc, so we installed this one without any problems, just plug and play. The fps went from 30 to 70 and my son said it was the best christmas present ever! It is very small, good for computers with not much space inside, and low power consumption. So good, we bought another for my other sons computer. Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: bensmum

customer_reviews.title: Great option for small form factor low power requirement systems
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very little noise (even under load). I have used it to play Mad Max and The Witcher 3 at 1080p on high detail level settings and there hasn't been a sign of a stutter or delay. I would recommend this for anyone who wants a low wattage graphics card that can still play recent titles at high settings. I am very pleased with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: seanm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for Small Form Factor PC's
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a 2012 HP Compaq Elite 8300 Small Form Factor PC, with an I5 3470 and 8GB RAM. This computer is using the original (good quality) 240W SFF power supply and has had no problems running this 75W card. It easily plays most (but not the really high RAM requirement) modern games at 1080p, 60 FPS at High (some Ultra) settings. It plays all eSport games at Ultra settings at way above 60 FPS. Great card to use if you want to reinvigorate an older small form factor PC.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant energy saving card.
customer_reviews.text: This is a low energy card that gives a great output. I replaced an ageing HD5070 which has plenty of graphics power but is hugely expensive to run. This new card uses far less power and yet gives a crisp sharp output. Graphics seem more alive with a denser colour and sharper edges.I thoroughly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: NigeM

customer_reviews.title: More Bang for your buck than you think
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought Battlefield 1 and my GTX 660 was not cutting it. Even though I paid way over the RRP for this due to the high demand at the time, I am more than happy about it. This card is half the size of my old one and 4 times as good. I get 60fps playing BF1 on Ultra with my LG Ultrawide easily.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great card to update older PC with low power PSU
customer_reviews.text: Bought to upgrade the APU graphics on my AMD A8 7600 PC. Easy install, I just disabled the on-board graphics and set everything to use the new card instead, got the latest drivers and off it went. getting around 4x faster frame rate than the on-board R7 APU graphics. runs cool and quiet and doesn't need extra power leads and my 240w PSU is fine and powering it through the PCI-e slot only. great buy at £139 too!
customer_reviews.author: Gerryf

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for you buck period, for not at least (older PSU/motherboards only!)
customer_reviews.text: Best graphics card on the market if you have no power cable on your PSU, period. More modern GFX require a PSU cable so this is as good as it gets if you don't have one and it can play games like Killer Instinct on maxed settings but begins to show its age on more recent titles like Civilization 6 and Street Fighter 5 Arcade Edition. Still more than playable however but will be obsolete in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: LoverofRedHair

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for an Entry-Level Gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: I have used this wee beauty for almost 12 months and can safetly say this is the best 1050 Ti card out there. It sources all it's power from the motherboard, can fit in every build (even Mini-ITX I believe) , and can handle 1080p gaming on most games fairly well. With newer title games, of course you won't be able to max out settings, you'll probably get the best performance on Medium settings on all the AAA games. But with less demandiing games like Fortnite, CS:GO, Rocket League etc. you'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Brings My Old Pc Back To Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I was using the old Radeon 7770 1gb card and using a 400 watt old power supply and a 6 core AMD FX CPU 16gb ram i changed my video card with the new Nvidia Geforce GTX 1050 TI 4gb and all my Games fly the newest game i got Gears of war Ultimate Everything on ultra setting at 1080p it flys. Also it dont need a 6 pin power supply it draws 75 watts off the main motherbored no extra power Needed.
customer_reviews.author: r d muller

customer_reviews.title: The 1050Ti is a good entry level graphic card.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great graphic card and can play most of the games on the market at the moment although some of them at the lower setting. I would suggest you buy else where as zotac never delivered but if you are looking to upgrade a good budget card you can't go far wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Greebo

customer_reviews.title: A great budget card to invest in
customer_reviews.text: A great budget card to invest in! Considering the price, it's a great choice as it can run most recent titles on high without a problem. Only drawback I would say would be the limitations of the 2GB VRAM, which you bump into on a few occasions; e.g trying to put Tom Clancy's Rainbow 6 Siege textures on high, so if it's within your budget I would advice to go with the TI version if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Excellent graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Excellent graphics card, I play World or Warships, this card achieves over 80 FPS using half the power of my older GeForce GTX570 which manages just over 40 FSP two six pin power connectors and an 800 watt PSU. Double the frame rate half the power consumed, nice little saving.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: great and only 155 pre ordered fitted in seconds
customer_reviews.text: great and only 155 pre ordered fitted in seconds, simple, omly problem i had was my previous card had mini hdmi cable and i needed a full size hdmi fitting,my stupidity left me flapping until i figured out there are two different types of hdmi, this was a bargain, now my computer needs upgrading to the card
customer_reviews.author: sparky_67

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable performance for £149.99. Doesn't even require a 6/8pin pin. Runs all the latest titles (Dishonoured 2, RE7) on vHigh/ultra @ 1080p (60fps) whilst never going over 55 degrees. Runs Overwatch @120-200fps @ 1080p on minimal settings. Highly impressed & definitely recommend those of you who want to play games without blowing £600 on a monster card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This card has very good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This card has very good value for the price. At this level the performance difference between any 1050 cards is negligible so the low price is a great incentive to get this one. I got this specific card from the Warehouse Deals on Prime day and it was just as good as a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Sandu

customer_reviews.title: excellent works great!
customer_reviews.text: got this for my sons computer , he is happy with it, plays a lot of games on it and not said anything about it struggling on anything yet , so all good.
customer_reviews.author: MR D H PERRY

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant graphics card 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend tho graphics card for a low budget and also packs a punch and can run variety of games. Definitely worth its money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This is a great graphics card. It can smoothly run GTA 5 at 70 fps and Battlefield 1 at 60 fps along with a Intel I3 6100!
customer_reviews.author: John Tucker

customer_reviews.title: 1 year and still great
customer_reviews.text: Ive had it for a year and feels good still, cant play the newest games at max settings obviously but i can play at medium-lowish, (still better than console) but for games like csgo LOL you will have no problems 100+ fps max settings
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: great runs fm17 in ultra ran project cars on ultra except when I went karting. Its quiet and compact and doesn't need any fancy power supply with 6/8pin extra power. If I was ever going to fix other people's computers with video output problems I'd whip that out of my machine and take with me . Software gets windows 10 to asks if sure all the time
customer_reviews.author: The Worm

customer_reviews.title: not for l4d2
customer_reviews.text: OK value for money, but won't run titles such as Left 4 Dead 2 at 1080p medium at adequate frame rate. Source games below 130fps will have input latency, and the 1050ti does not even hold that up on such an old title.
customer_reviews.author: Rıley

customer_reviews.title: Woah Nice Graphics
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks awesome now. I don't have much of a frame of reference though as my last computer would suffer palpitations when trying to play Heroes of the storm on lowest settings. Needless to say this is a big step up from there.
customer_reviews.author: Dangeross

customer_reviews.title: Superb quiet, compact and great driver support. Windows 10 running Fortnite (PERFECT)
customer_reviews.text: Very compact graphics adaptor plays fortnite on highest settings at 60fps - great value for money and uses motherboard power so no additional power needed.
customer_reviews.author: MartinK

customer_reviews.title: Images misleading for Zotac GeForce GTX 1050Ti OC Edition
customer_reviews.text: Images displayed show 2 heat pipes on the heat sink. There are none and the manufacturers webpage shows images without
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: Bang for buck on this card is phenomenal. Capable of running unreal 4 engine at moderate settings at 1080p, which will pretty much cover games for a couple of years. You can tweak and get better quality/performance as well, but for 159 quid, it beats anything in the price bracket by some way. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Blankley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price and does a fantastic job. Ideal for an upgrade to a five year old self-build.
customer_reviews.author: Aarovic

customer_reviews.title: Great performance from this PCI-e only powered graphics card.
customer_reviews.text: My Dell XPS 420 from 2007 was in desperate need of a graphics upgrade, but only has PCI-e and a 375 watt power supply. This easy to fit, easy to set up, reasonably priced and reasonably powerful graphics card was just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great budget card
customer_reviews.text: Great budget card, came in and plugged it in, however if your monitor is an old monitor which VGA output, you will require an active DVI-D Dual Link cable and a simple VGA to VGA with an adapter added on the end didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value for money. Runs the latest games quite well without compromising too much on the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D.

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: used this to upgrade an older pc , which It does well as I was limited with space in the case . works well impressed I am .
customer_reviews.author: G. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great GPU, does the job and runs anything on decent settings
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Fitted a SFF Dell desktop. Performance is very good.
customer_reviews.author: ARF

customer_reviews.title: Zotac Geforce GTX 1050 - An excellent graphics card
customer_reviews.text: An excellent graphics card packed into a shorter card length at a great price. Performance is pretty good as well with detail and colour depth looking sharp and clear respectively. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burlison-rush

customer_reviews.title: Fast Graphics
customer_reviews.text: Big advance in graphics capability for my PC. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Very well packed NOT AS SMALL AS SHOWN IN PHOTO
customer_reviews.text: Comes well packed and comes with a quick installation disk so just put it in and install drivers and can't wait to use it in my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic card
customer_reviews.text: A present for my Brother. The card is working well and his gaming has improved
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get Rocket League
customer_reviews.text: It is a great gpu specially for the price it works flawlessl. Only problem is it said it would come with a free copy of rocket league but it didnt come in paper nor in my email. It would be appreciated if you fixed this.
customer_reviews.author: Aadil S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent graphics card.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent graphics card. Powerful with low power consumption and a suitably efficient radiator heatsink with quiet fans. You can't go wrong with this graphics card in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Alazarin Mobius

customer_reviews.title: Great budget card for anyone not mining for Crypto!
customer_reviews.text: Nice card. Does the job. Good price, quick delivery. Easy to fit. All good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Gowans

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a faulty card with this. It is quieter than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: markmallard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product! Can run games on high or ultra
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Product! Can run games on high or ultra! Great price for gaming on a budget! Very easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Murray

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good however minimum fan speed is 45% so be aware it wont be quiet.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good bang for buck graphics card. It was very easy to install and replace my old GTX 750ti 2GB card, I used the same software and drivers. Did not have to uninstall or download anything on my PC. It is pretty small and quiet too and runs on power through the slot on the motherboard. I noticed a big increase in performance in several games after some tweaking. For example on my old card I ran Fallout 4 and Doom on medium settings, with this card I can now run on Ultra at 60 fps with some minor adjustments. I'm on a tight budget for PC gaming and this card has been an amazing upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah73

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant little card. - performance on a reasonable budget.
customer_reviews.text: This card is great, it offers great "bang for buck" performance, running the latest games at good FPS and settings, and older/simple games at max. It has a great clockspeed ( the highest out there along with the G1 gaming as far as i can see at stock frequencies, not to mention the gpu boost 3.0 that takes it up to 1835 mhz at 47 degrees which is amazing ). It's also really small. No longer than the pcie slot so will fit In almost all cases and OEM machines. It doesn't even need any extra power connectors so don't worry about having a poor power supply. The 4 year extra warranty is a also a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: great but........

customer_reviews.title: Zotac got a new fanboy
customer_reviews.text: What a card... Powerful as hell... After installing, the entire PC has more get up and go. Even bootup times are improved. I can only assume that this is because I have invested in a very well designed and that the Driver is efficient instead of clogging up the PC. My past cards (Palit) were guilty of having parasitic drivers. Playing games is now a luxurious experience. I can now only benefit from upgrading the rest of the PC........... £
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.text: love the 1050 aswell as the ti and this card is also a great example of one great size would be able to fit into any newer case and even the old cases it would fit in so if you are looking to upgrade your system on a budget i would recommend this card too you. again no power connectors no no need to worry about cable management and a big cable being dragged across your system. very impressed
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Good enough if yourre on a budget
customer_reviews.text: it seems to be a good enought card as i get about 100 fps in menus etc. and about 50 to 70 in game. Wouldn't recommend enything worde than this and it would probably be better if you got a 1050ti
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Pendleton-Crane

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Cool and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Great card for the money and hasn't let me down
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: 14nm Graphics cards from Nvidia!
customer_reviews.text: Well done Samsung! They have made a fantastic 14nm (yes not 16nm) graphics card. The colours are better than the 16nm cards, clean sharp edges with great detail.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. O. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description
customer_reviews.text: Description says this card requires 75 watts to run but on the box that it came in, it says 300 watts minimum or greater. It does not run because of this. Not happy at all especially for the money I paid for this card.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

product_meta.title: Zotac GeForce GTX 1050 2 GB Mini Graphics Card - Black
product_meta.description:
Size Name:1050 GPU| Style Name:Mini, 2GBEveryone deservers great gaming. That's why Nvidia created the fast, powerful GeForce GTX 1050. Now, you can turn your PC into a true gaming rig, powered by NVIDIA Pascal - the most advanced GPU architecture ever created. It's loaded with innovative NVIDIA Game Ready technologies that let every gamer experience the latest titles in their full glory.

BOX CONTAINS
1x ZOTAC GeForce GTX 1050 2GB Mini Graphics Card
User Manual
Driver CD

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,980 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
